citeinfo.title: Important Farmland, San Luis Obispo County, California, 1996

pubinfo.publish: California. Farmland Mapping and Monitoring Program

citeinfo.othercit: These data were retrieved from the California Farmland Mapping and Monitoring ftp site <ftp://ftpconsrv.ca.gov/pub/Dlrp/FMMP> on July 13, 2016.

citeinfo.title: California Farmland Mapping and Monitoring Program 1996

pubinfo.publish: California. Farmland Mapping and Monitoring Program

descript.abstract: This polygon shapefile represents areas of important farmland in San Luis Obispo County, California for 1996. Established in 1982, Government Code Section 65570 mandates FMMP to biennially report on the conversion of farmland and grazing land, and to provide maps and data to local government and the public.
descript.purpose: The Farmland Mapping and Monitoring Program (FMMP) provides data to decision makers for use in planning for the present and future use of California's agricultural land resources. The data is a current inventory of agricultural resources. This data is for general planning purposes and has a minimum mapping unit of ten acres.

idinfo.accconst: No restrictions on access or use. A citation for the Farmland Mapping and Monitoring Program on any map products, graphic media, or data analyses based on the data is appreciated.
idinfo.useconst: This data does not reflect general plan or zoning designations, city limit lines, changing economic or market conditions, or other factors which may be taken into consideration when land use policies are determined. This data is not designed to be used for parcel specific planning purposes due to its scale and the size of the minimum mapping unit (10 acres). The Department of Conservation makes no warranties as to the suitability of this data for any particular purpose.

cntorgp.cntorg: California. Farmland Mapping and Monitoring Program

idinfo.datacred: California Farmland Mapping and Monitoring Program. (1996). Important Farmland, San Luis Obispo County, California, 1996. California Farmland Mapping and Monitoring Program. Available at: http://purl.stanford.edu/bb033gt0615.
